Reviews.Title: “Hospitally during Hurricane Issac”
Reviews.Author: Jeff K
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a business trip to New Orleans. During the trip, Hurricane Issac hit New Orleans closing the airport for several days. The owner, Blake Miller and his staff went to extraordinary effort to safe guard their guests and to make their stay comfortable and enjoyable. I strongly recommend this property and commend the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Will Not Return”
Reviews.Author: Ilze E
Reviews.Content: Rooms are just OK; location is perfect BUT - staff are not helpful, parking is an extra $28.00 per night, there is no bar, lounge, anything and for me the worst part came after we left - I realized we had left behind in a dresser drawer two rather expensive Mardi Gras masks we bought as souvenirs for the kids. I called the front desk - the bored sounding woman told me "oh well we don't keep touristy junk it would just have been thrown out' - really? Why did she assume it was 'touristy junk'? I know she did not go up to the room to look for them as I asked her - she was too lazy. I called for two days before I got the manager who made up some nonsense story about how 'they were accidently thrown out' - really? Stuff left in a DRESSER drawer gets thrown out? The masks were stolen - end of story - and the hotel manager could not think of a way to make up for that awful situation. Don't stay here. This is not hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “6BR Townhouse Made for a Quality Bachelor Party”
Reviews.Author: EatEverything
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 6BR Townhouse for my bachelor party. I definitely got the feeling that this place is used to bachelor parties. If you are interested in a very clean well maintained house, this is not for you. However if you're a true bachelor looking to have a good time for a couple of days this could work out for you. It has a ton of places to sleep which is really all you need during the night. During the day, sitting by the pool down the road (also part of the suites) is great for recovery time. Besides the cleanliness, the one complaint I had was with the air conditioning. They had a sign saying not to turn it below a certain temp. in order to prevent freezing. We ignored this and turned it down a few degrees cooler and it seemed to work just fine. Also note that there is another unit directly below you which will probably have a bachelor party in it as well. So if noise is a factor for you then forget about it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Jazztrotter
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay close to the French Quarters (just across the road) and still pay a reasonable price - this is the place. We got rooms in the "sister hotel" next door, but it is all part of the same complex with a nice common backyard with pool etc. Don't expect luxury standard, but basic, clean and good accomondations with friendly staff. Due to the trafic it is probably smart to avoid the rooms facing Rampard street. Pool area however is nice and calm - a perfect place to relax. The best feature is the perfect location, at least if your want to experience fantastic New Orleans. We walked around French Quarters, Louis Armstong park and the neighbour area and felt absolutely safe. Bourbon Street is a few blocks away (about 5 min walk), but we recommend to continue towards the river where you find more attractive streets (E.g. Royal street). The continental breakfast only consists of bread, fruit, and waffles. All in all it was great value for the money. Will stay again if we come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice staff, a bit cramped houses”
Reviews.Author: TravelingSlim
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 5 bedroom house that the hotel offered which is designed for 20 people for Jazz Fest. Good - Location is perfect just a short 15 minute walk to Frenchman St, Burbon and the jazz Fest Park. You are just two block from the city bus to Jazz fest. You are a little distance away from all the craziness which i thought was nice. - The staff at the hotel is great and always willing to help. - The room and the beds were comfortable. - There is a continental breakfast and pool that are included as part of the house rental. - Fresh bathroom cleaning service daily - which is great for a house. Could be improved... The setup is such that there are 4 bedrooms on the 1st floor and then 1 large attic area with - 6 beds for 10 people. So, it can get cramped fairly quickly. - In the entire house for 20 people has only two (2) bathrooms. Ultimately, it could use two more bathrooms. - The kitchen is pretty basic with some kitchenware but it could use dishwashing material and a drying rack. Overall, it was a okay stay where it seemed more like a hostel then a hotel. We would stay here again if we came to NOLA in a book group but may look into staying in their hotel rooms as well.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again”
Reviews.Author: WDWJody
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small and the bathroom tiny with no bathtubs. However, this hotel has a certain charm to it. The outside rooms have usable shutters on the doors and windows and the inside rooms have a great staircase leading up to them. It is just a few walkable blocks to Bourbon St. The perfect place for a fun stay in New Orleans. I hope to be staying here again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Lovesherveggies
Reviews.Content: This place took care of us when no one could! they came through with rooms for the eight of us (woment) at the last minute. They were pretty clean, not completely dated but very comfortable. The hospitality of the staff truly made it wonderful. Great courtyard, free crawfish boil for the guests. We could not have had a better time and we adored this place! Would totally return. just across the street from the Quarter so very accessible plus the bus line is at the front door. Very convenient!

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Accommodations for large party groups”
Reviews.Author: ACarey439
Reviews.Content: I would absolutely give the French Quarter Suites Hotel five stars as it met and exceeded our expectations for what we were looking for. To be clear, I traveled to New Orleans with a large group (15) for Jazz Fest. We needed a large apartment (rented one of their townhouses) that was in an accessible area. We didn't want anything fancy, just a place to rest our heads in between shows and the festival. The townhouse was exactly what we were looking for. They are old buildings, so nothing is brand new, but that was perfect for our needs. It is walking distance from everything in the French Quarter and on Frenchman, on a main road with easy access to taxis, on the bus route that goes straight to Jazz Fest and also just far enough that you don't have loud bars right outside your place. We were also really impressed that we were allowed access to the hotel amenities, even though we were just staying in a townhouse. We had access to both pools, which was great for the hot afternoons. There was often a large, young crowd playing music and hanging out there, which was fun. The front desk was able to let us into the townhouse if one of us forgot keys (at all hours), which happened several times. But the biggest thing that wowed us all was the big crawfish broil they held on Saturday night at the pool. There was unlimited crawfish, corn, homemade fried chicken, and beer that was all completely out of this world. And it was ENTIRELY FREE (well, 'included,' but still). The servers wouldn't even take tips. To me, that was a really nice gesture to bring all their guests together for a gathering and some hospitality. So to reiterate, I would absolutely recommend this property to people who are looking for basic rooms/townhouses that are walking distance from the Quarter. If you are used to the Ritz, this is not your place, but it was great for everything we needed as a large group.

Reviews.Title: “perfect vacation”
Reviews.Author: unashamedlychelsea
Reviews.Content: I'm on my way back from a fantastic weekend in New Orleans at the French Quarter Suites! I came with my partner and another couple - we split a one-bedroom suite and loved every second of it! The hotel is in an ideal location that allowed us to walk everywhere from Bourbon Street to Frenchmen to Marigny while feeling safe and sound. We had everything we needed and were welcomed and well taken care of at the hotel. I would recommend FQS for any New Orleans vacation, short or long!

Reviews.Title: “amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: Jaci F
Reviews.Content: i just returned home from a 5 day vacation in the quarter with 3 other people, and this hotel was amazing. great location, incredibly clean, and ridiculously nice staff. Blake at the front desk was awesome. He recommended some fantastic restaurants and bars. in fact, he was so nice, that after check in, i told my friends that not only would i come back to stay here again in a heartbeat, but that i would also recommend this place to everyone i know. We had a wonderful experience and a fabulous vacation.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Peter R
Reviews.Content: We arrived in New Orleans for the first time from Paris, France and were welcomed from the first moment. Our rooms were very comfortable and extremely clean, the breakfast was fresh and delicious, and the location of the hotel next to the French Quarter was perfect. The most impressive thing about the hotel was the caring service we received throughout our stay from the entire staff. Most of all we apprecisted the attentions of the manager, Roy Malone, who did every thing in his power to make our stay enjoyable. He suceeded admirably. We had a wonderful time thanks to his efforts and the courteous staff. We would return to this hotel everytime that we come to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Mardi gras weekend girls only trip!”
Reviews.Author: Alexandra P
Reviews.Content: Me and 7 other girls came here for Mardi gras From Friday until Wednesday. I have to say i was plesantly surprised with the hotel! Check in was some what confusing as they have to lobbys, I waited in line behind another checkin for 20 mins only to be told i needed to check in at the other side, annoying to say the least. But after that check in was a breeze! Both of our rooms were average as expected, nothing to write home about but they did the trick! Now the best parts of the hotel as the location and free breakfast! Hotel is located just outside of the french quarters but very accessible to everything! We never felt too far away to walk where ever we wanted! The breakfast was a typical continental breakfast heavy on breads light on Fruit, but the make it yourself waffles were delicous! We took advantage of this 3 times we were there... Now the Bad parts of the trip... The people in NOLA are very hospitable and welcoming! Most of our hotel staff was as well, but we were there for 5 days and our housekeeper only brought towels and dumped them on our beds! No change of sheets, No trash removal, no toilet paper, Nothing... just fresh towels! I mean come on, the least you can do is take out the trash! By the end of our trip we had a corner piled with trash as some form of containing it! Went to the front desk and asked for toilet paper as it had not been refreshed for our entire trip, I was told to get it from the bathroom in the hallway! Not really what you expect to here from someone who is supposed to be serviceing you! So I made sure i took all of the extra rolls there since i knew it would be a while before we recieved anymore! For the most part this hotel is acceptable to stay in for an event but I probably wouldn't choose it for a normal visit to NOLA as some of the other hotels are more affordable and offer much more servcie for the price. We paid $300 a night for this hotel only because of mardi gras, so if you will be staying during an event this is probably an affordable hotel!

Reviews.Title: “We had a fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: Schudavizen
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal online, $650 for a four night stay in a two bedroom suite (4 adults), never paid a dime until we arrived. Worried about location but it turned out to be a pleasant walk to Bourbon, Royal, etc. Blake was so accomodating, reccomended some great restaurants. Requests for extra blankets, batteries for TV remote handled immediately. Some traffic noise but who comes to NOLA to sleep? Walked everywhere, never felt uncomfortable or unsafe. Gas station two doors down has food, drinks, etc. The outdoor area was lovely, never used the pool but enjoyed looking at it. Continental breakfast was sufficient; coffee, juice, breads and waffles. Fresh oranges too. Rooms were adequate,not new or updated but it's New Orleans, everything is old! That is half the charm! Gorgeous staircase in the front hall, loved the architecture. There are certainly more modern places to stay but for the price, it was a great value. When I travel, I want to get the local feel, no Holiday Inn. If you are looking for that, this is the wrong place. Great balcony along the second floor for people watching. Relax and enjoy the character of the place. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Phyllis L
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the French Quarter Suites Hotel. Suite was very comfortable, hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Walking distance to everything in the French Quarter, practically next door the the Louis Armstrong Park. Comfortably walked back to suite from Bourbon Street after dark.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible place to stay--Beware!”
Reviews.Author: emcd76
Reviews.Content: We arrived to find out that we would be staying in the New Orleans next door to the French Quarter Hotel and Suites. We booked our room in October, and a $250 deposit was withdrawn from our checking account immediately. Our trip was not scheduled until December 29. This deposit was suppose to be half of our stay; however, again when we arrived we were surprised to find out differently. Our total ended up being $765 for Thursday - Sunday nights. After that shock, we were given a room upstairs with no elevator to help carry luggage. The room was horrible. I wish I would have taken pictures. The bed was hard and slanted downhill. The bedspread was stained and contained a horrible smell. Thank goodness the sheets were clean. However, the bathroom was nasty. The sink area was very, very small -- only the sink with a mirror. The shower was also nasty, and you had to wait at least 15 minutes for hot water everytime you wanted to take a shower or use hot water. I called the front desk; the repronse I received was not helpful at all. The lady told me that there was nothing she could do and that was just the way it was. Also, we had to use earplugs every night just to try to get any sleep. The sound of the traffic from North Rampart was unbelievable. ...Location was also bad.. This hotel appeared to be in a rough part of town, and we had to walk many, many blocks to get to Bourbon Street. I did not feel safe when walking. When we checked in the hotel clerk told me to stay on Ursaline St. to get to Bourbon. (This was a big clue to me that it was not a safe place to be.) The continental breakfast does only consist of various types of bread, fruit, and waffles as stated in some of the other reviews....... Please try to find somewhere else to stay...don't waste your money on this place.

Reviews.Title: “Good location & character, tatty at the edges”
Reviews.Author: David C
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location on the edge of the French Quarter and walking distance from Bourbon Street (although we were recommended to get a cab after dark for safety). The rooms have good character although a drawer in ours had stuff from a previous visitor in it so housekeeping could be better. The pool was good although a few bits of plants/leaves floating in it. Breakfast was good although almost entirely carbs (waffles and a wide variety of breads). The (female) receptionist in the day was outstanding and booked our bus tour for us as well as spending a good deal of time helping us find good places to eat and showing us the best route to walk to get everything we wanted to do done in the time we had.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby Chic and Haunted!!!”
Reviews.Author: tonyboy2000
Reviews.Content: Yes, most of the reviews you have read here are correct about this ain't a 5 star hotel; but it's what we were looking for when coming to the French Quarter. I didn't want a Marriott, I wanted character. Character, Pools, breakfast and location worked for us. It wasn't fancy but was fine for our needs. What we didn't expect was seeing what we believed to be ghosts. I didn't like reading that the staff was unfriendly; we liked them rather well. William help me book the room and was most helpful of what to see and do in the area. Thanks William! Ghosts, yep, I woke up one morning and noticed about 6 or 7 round happy faces just watching us sleep. Of course I thought this was just a dream so I sat up, rubbed my eyes and took another look. They were in the front room and our beds were in the back room. I looked over at them again and there they were, smiling, turning their heads from side to side, just watching us sleep. I thought, "when I tell my partner about this one he's sure to have me committed". So later that day over lunch I jokingly told him about what I'd seen. Of course he didn't believe me so that was the end of that dicussion. Surprise, surprise, the next day he too had a similar experience and told me about it. It was in April when we were there so I cannot remember the room number, maybe 116 or 106. Needless to say, it gave us a good story to tell. There is great dining and history here, upscale or a dive we had it all; be sure to get to the Garden District, go to the local plantations, Bloody Mary's are the best way to begin your days here, oysters were great, gumbo gumbo gumbo. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay - good location”
Reviews.Author: LSG2011
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights for a girls weekend . Room was ok. Needs updating! Nice breakfast area and food was ok. Good location to bourbon street and other sights of New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby, but not chic”
Reviews.Author: scott t
Reviews.Content: We stayed there at the advice of friends. A bedroom one was 169.00, with parking and taxes,a 2 night stay was $442.00. This is located off the quarter, in not a really good part of town. The property is old, a selection of buildings and old houses. The room smelled, but was clean. The sofa was dilapidated, the bed sagged and was uncomfortable, the bedding was stale and the blanket dirty. There is no working wifi, as advertised, and no in-room safe - a staple for New Orleans hotels. Friends had a townhouse, which was very bad, old saggy furniture and beds. If you want to enjoy New Orleans - look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Homey, comfortable, big rooms at great locale!”
Reviews.Author: heyguise
Reviews.Content: Once you enter through the gates, it feels like you've arrived in an oasis in the middle of the urban, gritty and visually fertile North Rampart corner of the French Quarter. We got a room on the second floor where all the rooms on that side of the building shared a balcony with tables and chairs. We often sat here eating our oyster po boys or bignets while watching all the characters on the street below. And speaking of rooms, our room was fantastic. It was a 2 bedroom suite with a little living room and 2 very comfortable bedrooms. The bathroom was well maintained vintage, and huge. We traveled with my dog, who felt right at home. Louis Armstrong Park is just a block away, and he loved our daily walks there. In addition, the hotel provides an area to walk your dog in the back of the building. Staff couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful. Michael went out of his way to help us at every turn. Our Metairie relatives were worried about the area and wanted to move us. We've been coming to New Orleans my entire life, my grandmother has been coming for 60 years. We know what's what. We felt perfectly safe in the hotel, it's very secure. I wouldn't necessarily go walking around by myself at night, but I think that's probably a good rule in general when traveling anyway. It's close enough to the action to enjoy all the fun but is a great retreat when you're ready to recover, renew and start all over again. My grandma wants to stay at French Quarter Suites from now on when we visit. She said she likes how "funky, non-corporate and clean" it is. I couldn't agree more so I will happily oblige.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: hughes07052005
Reviews.Content: We went to Moblie, Alabama for a funeral and needed some uplifting fun. So we all jumped in the car and drove 1 1/2 to NOLA! When we called all the hotels in the area they kept telling us that they were full or nobody would answer. We drove up to this hotel, and the gentleman informed us there was a concert there and that they would be more than happy to assist us. They gave us a 1 bed room suite and told us all about the town. My boyfriend has always stayed there and we went once before and I had the worst experience! However, this time made up for last time and probably 3 more times! I had such a great experience with the the hotel!! Keep it up, the reception area was amazing and the staff was more than friendly

Reviews.Title: “Saving grace is that is near the French Quarter.”
Reviews.Author: Erica1018
Reviews.Content: Mold and mildew in the old shower. Comforter smelled like dog pee. Can't change temperature in the room so it was too hot to sleep. Self controlled A/C would bring me back. Otherwise, I will never stay there again. Too many other hotel choices for kind of money. One night was $154.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Stay”
Reviews.Author: tessbroz
Reviews.Content: this hotel is off the beaten path but close enough if you want the craziness. The front desk staff can be warm and welcoming or rude and abrasive (depending on who is working). I've stayed here 4 times and enjoyed it. Great pool area and courtyard. The rooms used to be reasonable but then again, the price vacilates depending on who is working. Secure parking. Breakfast is lean. lots of Eurokids on holiday. Internet doesn't always work. Pet friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: smiesowitz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in April with a group of ten girls on a bachelorette party. It was a great value for the money and the location is perfect. I'm from NY so I don't mind walking but really you're right on the edge of the French Quarter so it's not to go out at night. The neighborhood was not as pretty as the French Quarter but still fine. The rooms were a bit old but you get what you pay for. The staff was very nice and friendly. Breakfast is included. Two nice pools. All in all we were very happy with this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great basic budget hotel w/ great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: vickigrapsas
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and provides a comfortable place to stay at a good price. The staff is friendly and helpful- true Southern Hospitality. They are willing to call cabs, provide restaurant recommendations, and help you out at all hours of the night. Location is walking distance to the french quarter and a short cab ride away from everything else. A great choice if you are looking for a basic hotel with a great price!

Reviews.Title: “We had a perfect weekend in New Orleans.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location and the friendly efficient FQS Hotel staff made our weekend in the French Quarter one of the best ever. Being a short walk from Bourbon street and the best restaurants was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: lildebbie77
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my husband and my best friend. We stayed for two nights between Mardi Gras and Saint Patrick's Day in a one room suite. Pros: The entire place was very clean. The staff was wonderful. The lady that checked us in went out of the way to find information on good places for a vegetarian to eat. They are very dog-friendly. I've seen other reviews that say this isn't in a nice part of town, or that it feels unsafe after dark, but I don't understand that. N. Rampart Street is a major road on the edge of the Quarter - we walked through much darker/emptier roads in our walks around town. The pools looked wonderful. Both the living room and bedroom were very spacious. Cons: The reason for the low price is because a few things are a little outdated (the TVs aren't LCD, the bathroom hasn't been upgraded in awhile). But I wasn't going to NOLA to watch TV or take bubble baths! If you want to use the kitchen, be sure to bring cooking/eating vessels/utensils since there is nothing provided. We just used the fridge for drinks. The elevator is tiny! It's a little bit of a walk to the "fun" part of the French Quarter, but you'll get your exercise. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good at all!”
Reviews.Author: Billary
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a group during Mardi Gras. This place is a dump! The first day we saw a mouse in the kitchen. We told the Manager. He said with a grin, "don't bother the mouse and it will not bother you." The place was nasty. The carpets were never cleaned. Bathrooms gross! Towels were beyound use. In addition had to pay almost $200 tp partk the car for 5 days. This place in right on Rampart. Not the best part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Not a suggested hotel”
Reviews.Author: pobob1
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location to the Quarter, and, the beautiful courtyard. It goes downhill quickly from there. We had a 2 bedroom suite. The living area had just been redone, but, the bathroom was gross. The towels looked to be the original set from when the building was built, the beds and pillow were worse than ones I've seen in Motel 6's. There were cobwebs in all of the corners, hair in the bathtub and sheets.I slept on the mattress most of the nights as the sheets didn't fit. There was too inches of dust on the fans. The folks at the front desk seemed nice, but, did not have the authority to get anything done. It's a shame.....with a little bit of work and understanding what traveling customers are looking for.....this could be a great location. Get your act together!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, can't beat the price and only a few blocks from Bourbon St!”
Reviews.Author: PinkTacoTourGirls
Reviews.Content: I'm pretty sure we couldn't have met nicer staff then we did at the French Quarter Suites! They couldn't be more accommodating and all it took was one phone call and they were up immediately meeting our needs! The Continental Breakfast was probably one of the best ones I've ever had (yummy homemade waffles!) Roy even walked us to breakfast when we decided we wanted more than the Continental Breakfast (so sweet!!). The price for the room was unbeatable! We walked to most of our destinations then took the streetcars or buses from Canal St. Definitely buy the $5 day pass, it's worth it! You can buy it right on the streetcar! Bourbon St. is probably the most fun place ever!!! My friends and I (The Pink Taco Tour Girls :) can't wait to go back again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for large groups that need a bed and a roof over their head”
Reviews.Author: whereisnext
Reviews.Content: I was one of about 20 guys that stayed in the French Quarter Suites in late August and we absolutely loved it. We stayed in a huge townhouse with one massive bedroom on the top floor (which slept 8) and 3 smaller bedrooms on the ground floor which slept 2-3 a room. There was a lounge, kitchen and two bathrooms (both of which were needed when staying with so many people). While our house lacked amenities it did have the basics such as running water (although it was often warm), clean linen and towels, fridge and even free wi-fi although that was spotty downstairs. The real benefit was the opportunity for everyone to stay under one roof for $120 per person â€“ ideal for big groups. Additionally, the hotel had a swimming pool which was about a block down the street and a great way to cool off in the NO heat. Oh and a gas station that was open 24 hours and sold friend chicken and other yummy treats. It was about a 5 minute walk to Bourbon Street. If you're wanting to visit NOLA in a huge group and save money, then this place is safe, clean and cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but that's about it”
Reviews.Author: charlotteamy1984
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a "Trek America" tour. Having spent the previous 11 days camping, we were really looking forward to staying here, but it was a major let down. First of all, as we were travelling as part of a group, we were allocated to stay in two of their townhouses. The first was was adequate enough - nicely decorated and pretty spacious (although the beds were literally crammed into to the rooms like some sort of dorm or hostel) but the second smaller townhouse where my partner and I stayed was tiny, outdated and dirty - there were pubic hairs in the bath and among other things, there were toenail clippings on the floor (the carpets clearly hadn't been vacuumed). The toilet chain was also broken and would not flush, although to be fair to them they did send someone to fix it quite quickly. Another problem was that the larger townhouse was infested with mice and cockroaches. Whilst the staff were quite pleasant, they were not very helpful. They guy on the desk over the weekend knew literally nothing about the hotel or the local area. The only good things about the hotel were the breakfast - the waffles were delicious - and the close location to Bourbon Street and the nightlife. I would definitely not recommend this hotel, and would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for $$, good for families with children”
Reviews.Author: watermarkfarm
Reviews.Content: Family of 6 traveling w/children ages 9, 12, 15, and 16. We'd definitely stay here again. Nice pools and charming courtyard, location felt safe as it's fenced and gated, and there is a police station just down the street and a lot of police presence nearby. It's on the edge of the French Quarter and you are about 4-5 blocks from the action. Good value for the money. We rented two Junior Suites right by the main pool (the two tucked behind the staircase) and these are great if you are w/children as you can hang out by your room and watch the kids swim. Rooms were very plain and the bathrooms were kind of rough around the edges, but clean. Overall cleanliness a bit iffy in the corners, but OK. Beds were not great. Very charming old buildings with old European hotel feel and nice to get away from the cookie cutter hotels --- feels like a European pensione. Main hotel building is darling and has a great breakfast room. Breakfast was continental and basic, it would be nice if they offered fruit. Evenings were a bit lively with people coming back to their rooms late, but we did not hear much noise, and it was kind of fun to see. Staff was very helpful and professional. Wi-Fi was very poor. We really enjoyed our stay here even though the place is not perfect, it's pretty darn charming. Great deal for the money and nice to be away from the hub-bub of Bourbon St. area. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location not immediately on Bourbon”
Reviews.Author: ktrixie
Reviews.Content: I went to New Orleans with a couple of friends for a girls trip, and was overall satisfied with the French Quarter Suites. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, and I had found a rate online that was incomparable for something that close to the thick of the nightlife. The decor and facilities was dated and it had an overall aged and tired feel about it which is the only real complaint I have. Since it was just a home base for me in between going out, I would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Price for Location”
Reviews.Author: GojyoChan
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a place in the French Quarter where our extended stay wouldn't break the bank and this place was a great find. The place is made up of several old Victorian mansions that have been combined into one larger hotel. It's on the edge of the quarter away from the hustle and bustle of Burbon Street but if you're concerned about "the area" you're overreacting. It's quiet for the most part and we had no problems walking around late at night. The rooms are small, furnishings antique and minimal, and the walls are thin so don't expect the utmost in comfort but it fits the bill in getting your in the French Quarter at an affordable price. The pool is really great although I wish it were a bit larger and deeper. The hotel feels really authentic and charming though there are some issues with water pressure and temp in some of the rooms. We had some noisy neighbors that made one of our nights quite unpleasant but the hotel staff took care of the problem. The continental breakfast is pretty minimal and the room it's in is pretty cramped so get there early or skip it altogether.

Reviews.Title: “Unremarkable”
Reviews.Author: frequentflyer41
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent three nights at the French Quarter Suites Hotel. We found the room to be perfectly adequate, but it was nothing to write home about. We had a room with a queen sized bed that was right next to the pool. My boyfriend summed it up best when we first entered by describing it as "almost charming." It was a relatively small room, with an exposed brick floor and walls, and furniture that was in need of upgrading. The only closet was in the bathroom. The mattress was firm and the sheets were clean. We requested additional pillows as it only came with two. The biggest downside to the room was that there were no drapes on the windows and the the room was quite bright due to the lights in the courtyard around the pool. Based on some prior reviews, I brought a white noise machine with me, and it minimized any outside noise. Our air conditioner also worked nicely. The bathroom was also in need of updating, but otherwise clean. The towels were really flimsy, though, and it seems really odd that the owners did not invest a few dollars in buying some hooks for towels. We did not avail ourselves of the breakfast as it wasn't our type of food, but it consisted of waffles that you could make from batter yourself and various baked goods. The location was on the northern boundary of the French Quarter. We had stayed in that neighborhood before so knew what to expect, but it does appear a little dicey in that area. Some of the staff were friendly, some were quite unfriendly. (When we asked where the bus stop was to get to the Jazzfest, the man at the front desk declared that he had no idea. It turned out to be right across the street.) I should also mention that our friends stayed in the hotel at the same time that we did and their room had different issues. Although the room was bigger than ours, their air conditioning did not work very well and their room was warm. Their shower also was moldy, but it looked like it had been there for awhile.

Reviews.Title: “They would not honor their own coupon.”
Reviews.Author: TravelALotWisconsin
Reviews.Content: They advertised their coupon rates at the Visitor Center which is why we chose them. Then they glibly said "oh we don't honor our coupons" but you may be able to get that price next door. Next door told us the next day as we were checking out that there was a $25 parking fee added to the 'coupon' rate so we got ripped off twice from this establishment. Before we left we talked with a staff person in hopes of giving them a chance to remedy this poor first impression and there was no acknowledgment or comment. Very cold. Not only will we remember this place as dishonest it also gave us a bad feeling about New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the stay!”
Reviews.Author: vahillbilly
Reviews.Content: The French Quarters Suite Hotel provided us a charming stay. While the room was smaller than most chain hotels and some of the furniture needed to be repaired or replaced the ambiance and historical grace of this place made it well worth the sacrifice of space. If we ever travel to New Orleans again we won't need to search for a place to stay, this will be our choice. A couple of surprises though:(1) we didn't know about the $20 a day parking fee (2) the ride from the airport took us through what appeared to be a shady neighborhood and (3) the shutters on our entry door closed, providing us the privacy we weren't sure we would have when we first checked in (our room had a glass door with sheer curtains).

Reviews.Title: “Take a pass”
Reviews.Author: WestToronto78
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the French Quarter Suites/Courtyard Hotel with a large group over a few days in early March 2010. Staff in general were friendly and courteous, and the room was clean, but the mattress was as hard as a rock. The TV was set up behind one of the bedposts so the only way I could get an unblocked view of the screen was to sit on the extreme end of either side of the bed and lean out/in. Bathroom was clean but the shower was dark (no light in the shower), and there was no shelf/ledge to place your soap/shampoo. No hook on the back of the door for towels either. Location on the edge of the French Quarter was okay but the neighbourhood around the hotel was fairly dodgy after dark. The biggest problem with this hotel though was noise. There is no soundproofing between the courtyard area and the rooms surrounding it, so you can easily hear people walking/talking outside your room. What's worse if that if you're on the ground floor level, all you can hear is the creeking of the boards on the outdoor concourse as people walk to/from their rooms on the upper level.

Reviews.Title: “Southern Hospitality At It's Best”
Reviews.Author: Pamchowder
Reviews.Content: This Hotel puts your safety and leisure on its front burner. It is a beautiful hotel that exudes the positive of Southern and French attitude. The staff is kind, friendly, and informative, taking special care to provide you and your pet with a comfortable and clean environment. The location is perfect with just a short historical walk to the French Quarter. We read that safety is a concern in New Orleans, especially with parking. The hotel provides a locked and secure garage. Just read further!!!! The hotel's especially warm staff person, Velda, called me after their grounds person found that I left my laptop and carry-on bag in the hotel parking lot. We had not even missed these items and were driving into Texas when I received Velda's kind call. The items were mailed to me and arrived totally in tact. This is truly Southern hospitality at it's best.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, with Great Service!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nicholasjpepper
Reviews.Content: The suite was very clean, the front desk and housekeeping staff were professional and courteous. I stayed for my birthday weekend with some friends and they did everything they could to put us in rooms next to each other, even though it was a sold out weekend! I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanted to see New Orleans for the first time or if you frequent the city. I couldn't have asked for a better birthday!!!

Reviews.Title: “not very clean”
Reviews.Author: travelingquilter
Reviews.Content: my daughter and i stayed here because we were traveling with a pet, if we hadn't had the dog with us we would have changed hotels. it is a 3 block walk down to st. ann st, then another 5 blocks or so to the french quarter. that was not really the bad part of staying here, although walking back at night was scary. the room was so cold that they brought in a space heater which did nothing to heat up the room, they also brought us 3 extra blankets that didn't help much either...we froze that night! the worst part of the hotel was the dirty bathroom! it was horrible, stay somewhere else if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel, Friendly Staff, Cool Rooms”
Reviews.Author: tattoogirlgulfshores
Reviews.Content: Our Staff from David's gallery in Gulf Shores took a trip to New Orleans for Halloween. We found that the French Quarter Suites to be the best value around! The Staff was awesome and Extremely helpful and knowlegable about New Orleans.. John and Blake, were especially great. The hotel was only a 5 minute walk from Bourban street. Would definetly stay here again! They even called us to tell us about some items we had left behind by mistake. Very nice!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL---VALUE, CONVENIENCE, QUALITY”
Reviews.Author: LUDIDIT
Reviews.Content: This hotel was charming & aesthetically beautiful. The room was beautiful & quaint. We felt as though we were stepping back in time. The decor was beautiful, the room was clean & quiet. We had a private courtyard. Very convenient to the French Quarter. I couldn't believe the great rate we received. Staff was very knowledgable & helpful about the New Orleans area----where to go & what to see.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but the best, from service to employees a wonderful expeariance.”
Reviews.Author: vazquezjd
Reviews.Content: I have to say from the gated entrance, to the wonderful staff I would challenge anyone to find a better deal but I have looked and it does not exist. Any request I make, even things that they THOUGHT I needed were provided. If you wanted fancy mints on your pillow and silk pillow cases, go pay more. All that means is I will be able to get a room when I need it! They are friendly; they remember the repeat customer by name. I travel for medical appointments for my son and every employee from the housekeepers to the ground workers, the reception area, the managers, they are a blessing for those of us who travel with kids and live in the world where money is tight and has to be stretched as far as possible, I really believe they understand and feel my pain and do the best they can for me, and in todayâ€™s society that is rare. The location is great and we walk all around, I have read where some were unhappy about the location. Well my 1year old daughter walked all around (with me) and made friends everywhere she went (even the dangerous tattoo parlor. All I can say is I love this location, and they will be getting my repeat business for a very long time, help keep them in business by becoming a loyal member like me and my family!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed because all the good hotels I liked were sold out, otherwise this would not have been my choice”
Reviews.Author: ToyInBabeLand
Reviews.Content: I saw a review that described this place as "quaint." That's a perfect word for it. The room was spacious, it reminded me of a small apartment. It did smell a bit funny. The couch was sunken in at the middle and a bit grungy looking. We couldn't turn the AC lower than 72 or the coils would freeze. The room was constantly muggy. I slept without the blankets. We were told the hotel had WIFI, but none of could connect and we had two laptops amongst us. The view was pretty, it made us forget about the hotel flaws. It was right into the larger pool area. I think the part that made me dislike the hotel the most was the area. There were three of us, all female and we got a lot of unwanted attention on our way to the French Quarters. The walk is very quiet and empty. Some guy cussed at us for not telling him "hi" among a few other creepy experiences with disrespectful men. The ad says it's just steps from the Quarters, which is true. What they don't tell you, is that it's the dark steps, the most empty area of blocks before you get to the actual areas where there are crowds. I don't hate the place, I just wouldn't stay there again. The hotel I really wanted was offering the same price ($129.00) for two nights, parking included. Unfortunately, they were booked.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience of My Life”
Reviews.Author: rv1983
Reviews.Content: This is the WORST hotel I have ever stayed at in my life. There was absolutely nothing good about it. It claims to be in the French Quarter, and never having been to NOLA I didn't know that this hotel is located right on the edge that it's technically not even in the French Quarter. The rooms here are incredibly filthy. Our room stank of cigarette smoke even though it was supposed to be a non-smoking room. On our first day, I had to clean off the toilet seat to use it and pick up stray hairs that were obviously not mine from all over the room. On top of that, housecleaning only came in to clean ONCE on our four-night stay. The so-called free "continental" breakfast is an assortment of store-bought bread and some coffee and OJ. Don't count on eating this. Finally, the hotel had the nerve to charge us a $40 "cleaning fee" on top of what I had already signed for on my credit card upon checking out. The hotel is pet-friendly (I had brought my dog) and upon calling to inquire about this charge, I was told it was because they had to shampoo the carpet where my house-trained 4-year-old Yorkie had apparently made a mess. They claimed they did this several times during our stay, which doesn't seem likely considering the room was hardly ever cleaned. Do yourself a favor - don't even THINK about staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Warning: Inconvenient location and dirty”
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located a lot further away than what we had expected. The location is ok if you don't mind walking a bit or if you plan on taking a cab everywhere. Overall, the hotel is not very clean. The shower did not work and the room we stayed in had a strong cigarette smell - even though it was a non-smoking room. I visited a few rooms where my friends stayed and the rooms were not any better. Be aware: you may get charged a higher amount on your credit card for without any prior notice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: dac626
Reviews.Content: We were with a large group. We stayed in the Annex portion of the hotel and felt like we were staying in an old French Quarter house. The kids loved having two pools and the adults loved having access to the hotel. The rooms were great, comfortable, and very clean. The location was perfect, we were able to walk to all of our favorite New Orleans restaurants in the Quarter. I recommend this hotel and will be a returning guest. It is a GREAT place to stay and can't beat the rates. Thank you French Quarter Suites for a great weekend stay with lots of old friends. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “The only place I would stay”
Reviews.Author: Adamant22
Reviews.Content: I've stayed @ FQS for every Jazz Fest since 2005. I wouldn't go anywhere else. They acquired the adjacent hotel earlier this year which was a great bonus. The courtyard and pool are much nicer. There are different sections of the hotel and they are very different. If booking you might want to ask about what the different rooms are like. During JF we stay in the suites section (to cram as many people as possible). Yeah, some of the carpets in the suites section have seen better days. The owner told us he was going to replace them with tile at some point. The location is 5-star for us because it's across the street from the main part of the French Quarter (away from the noise) and has a taxi stand nearby (plus the major bus lines stop in front). The main reason we stay is because of the service. I find that in NOLA, the service is one extreme or the other. Either they can't do enough for you, or F U for even asking! FQS is definitely the former. They really will do anything they can to make your stay better. If you like to stay at the Hilton, maybe FQS isn't right for you. If you want something with more charm and character, then I'd stay here.

Reviews.Title: “What a fun weekend”
Reviews.Author: vacationtimeforme
Reviews.Content: I recently spent Memorial Day weekend at the French Quarter Suites with three of my best friends. We arrived on Friday and stayed through Tuesday. Our two bedroom suite worked perfect for our group. It was not a Hilton or the Ritz, but was more than we expected for the price. The staff was very accommodating and helpful. It was obvious that many upgrades were either recently made or were in the works. There were two beautiful swimming pools with a real New Orleans Courtyard feel. In fact, one night we decided to just stay around the pool with several other groups of guests. It was probably our most fun night. Bourbon Street was just three blocks away, and again the staff had many suggestions for where to go for dinner, shopping and late night. Not only would I stay there again, but I have booked the same room for a long weekend this fall.

Reviews.Title: “Quant, historical hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: OhioCbee
Reviews.Content: 4 friends and myself came in for a vacation, we wanted to have a 2 bedroom so we could have a little time away from each other if needed. From the moment we got to the hotel the staff was very friendly and courteous. They made us all feel special. If we requested anything at all, they came right away. I did not feel the hotel was dirty, however the building is old and is in the process of being remodeled. If you are looking for a quite, historical, New Orleans type hotel this is the place to be, if you are looking for a commercialized high rise I definately would not recommend it. We all had a great time and felt we were treated very well. They have a very nice courtyard and 2 pools, which we used with no problems. If I ever return to this area I would definately stay at the French Quarter Suites again.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, shabby, bad location”
Reviews.Author: flygirl7747
Reviews.Content: My friend and I decided that our yearly girl's adventure trip for 2009 would be New Orleans for the Jazz Fest. We booked a two bedroom suite at the French Quarter Suites for 5 nights, online. We were told that we had to pay a 50%, non-refundable deposit when we booked (our credit card was charged in November for an April trip). The web site said "steps from Bourbon Street". We had read some of the reviews that said that folks who had stayed there before had some concerns about the safety of the neighborhood so when we checked in we asked and were told about the best route to take to Bourbon Street for safety sake. Believe me, it was not "steps". It was a good 7 blocks to take the safe route. We were really disappointed when we made our way to our suite. The carpets were very worn and had large holes in some spots that showed the floor beneath. There were cobwebs and accumulated dirt along the edges of all the carpets and in the corners. There was a quarter inch of dust on the tops of the drapes. The bathroom floor was filthy. When we wiped up a little water that was on the bathroom floor, the towel came up black. The bathtub had mold around it and the sheets and pillowcases were stained and worn. I wouldn't have touched the bedspread with any part of my body. The washcloths are what I use for rags at home. The television in the largest bedroom didn't work. The small bedroom had room for just a bed and a small nightstand. There was a coffee maker but only little thin plastic cups that would not have held hot coffee. The refrigerator didn't work and was dirty inside. After walking over to Bourbon Street by the "safe" route in the daylight we realized that we would not be comfortable walking back that way at night. We went into the Ramada Inn on Bourbon Street and asked them if they had any rooms available for the weekend (this was Wednesday night). They said they had just one. We asked them to hold it for us until we could speak with the French Quarter Suites to see about cutting our stay with them short. I called the young man at the desk and he said I would have to talk to his manager and she wouldn't be in for about an hour. It ended up being nearly 11 pm before I was able to speak with the manager so we had to spend the first night in this awful hotel. The manager said that we could leave early but we would not receive any of our 50% deposit back. She never asked why we were leaving. She obviously didn't care. They following morning a different young man at the front desk (if you can call it that as it is really like a motel office with a check- in office) listened to our complaints (unsolicited) and said, "I'm sorry your room was dirty but we can certainly use the 2 bedroom suite this weekend." So we paid $700 for one night at this hotel and they were eager to re-rent it. The Ramada was wonderful. They gave us the regular rate for Thursday and Sunday night and the Jazz Fest rate for Friday and Saturday which we though was really nice of them. The four nights at the Ramada cost us just a little more than the 1 night at the French Quarter Suites and it was clean, comfortable and right on Bourbon Street. We had a courtyard view and no noise from the street. We were not expecting the French Quarter Suites to be luxury with a concierge and bellman, etc. but we did expect that it would be clean and comfortable. It was neither.

Reviews.Title: “U get what u pay for”
Reviews.Author: Jasper05
Reviews.Content: Friends and I stayed here couple weeks ago.We thought the staff was very helpful any and every way they could be.We did have to walk to get to are room which would not be good for the elderly.I believe they do need to give classes in HOW TO CLEAN to their maids.We had no problems with noise.Never seen any shady people as others talk about.We had a very nice stay and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome time”
Reviews.Author: hmaxwell79
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend, myself, and another couple we know traveled together to New Orleans this past weekend. We planned our trip a few weeks ago online. We wanted a suite with two rooms to share for a reasonable price that was close to Bourbon Street. We came across this hotel and booked online. Afterwards we looked on trip advisor and were alittle scared due to previous reviews. We brought clean sheeys and towels and pillows as a precaution. To our wonderful surprise, we had not needed any of these things. The room was very nice and quaint. The staff was very friendly and helpful to our needs. It was quaint and actually very quite. There are two courtyards with pools that were very clean and it is a short walk to everything! My only problem was parking. There is only about 10-15 spots in garage. The other parking is across street and you have to wait for staff to open up the gates. Also, it cost extra 20 per night to park. Other than that it was wonderful! Would stay there over and over again. Make sure to go on haunted history tour while there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Budget Travelers”
Reviews.Author: DecTraveler
Reviews.Content: Five co-workers and I stayed here while on business in New Orleans. I thought this hotel was great for the price (approx 130/night for a two bedroom suite). Other motels at this rate were in really bad or remote areas, but this hotel is right on the northern edge of the French Quarter. It is within walking distance to lots of great destinations in the French Quarter and the Marigny. The rooms are ok - nothing fabulous, but a good place to hang your hat in between working and going out on the town. The room I stayed in was a two bedroom suite. There was a central room, a bathroom, and two separate bedrooms. The carpets and the bathroom were somewhat dingy, but not unsanitary. Our room came with a refrigerator and microwave, but some rooms offer full kitchens. My room was in the back of the motel and therefore my internet connection was pretty weak. My co-workers had rooms in the front of the motel and they said their signal was very robust, though. I found the service to be good. Except for one employee, everyone was very friendly and helpful. The motel offers a secure pay parking lot. The rate is $20/day ($15/day for AAA members). If you are there for just a couple days this rate is probably ok, but if you plan on staying for longer you might want to investigate other parking options. A free breakfast is available in the morning. The breakfast is somewhat limited. It only includes coffee, bagels, muffins, biscuits, and danishes. I was disappointed that no juice, fruit, or cereal was offered. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone that is traveling on a limited budget because it is within walking distance to lots of New Orleans attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Tepid Charm”
Reviews.Author: Machinecog
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in one of the townhouses. We stayed for a long weekend. The hotel and townhomes are on an N. Rampart street- an extremely busy thoroughfare of a street. While the townhomes were quaint and charming, those qualities were offset by the busy, noisy street in which they reside. Accompanying vehicle traffic was foot traffic. Though we did not encounter any problems, my wife and I felt less than comfortable walking our dogs day and night on and around this street. Louis Armstrong Park was closed so we resorted to walking our dogs on Rampart Streetâ€™s grassy medianâ€¦less than ideal but it served our purpose. The townhome courtyards and vehicle parking are cordoned off from the street by security gates and are very appropriate and useful for this urban environment. I encountered three staff members and none of them really impressed me. I received the student job/Iâ€™m only doing this until my band/my art/my writing makes it vibe. My wife and I did not like the unit we reserved (its only door opened up to the street) and requested a transfer to a quieter townhome which the staff accommodated last minute although hardly graciously. This hotel serves its purpose but donâ€™t expect too much. The French quarter is across the street and Bourbon is three or four blocks away so it is close to â€œthe middle of itâ€�. It is merely a place to stay for pet owners and park your car for a reasonable price in close proximity to the French quarter. If the antiquity, charm, and character experience are what you are looking for in a hotel, a unit in the quarter will likely be the better option.

Reviews.Title: “VERY Unsanitary”
Reviews.Author: zephyrwisconsin
Reviews.Content: Upon check in there was hair in the bed, hair on the floor in the bathroom, stained sheets AND towels, dingy thin towels, arrogant and unhelpful staff, inoperable lamps and ceiling fans, wifi that doesn't work . It shouldn't take 20 minutes to check into any hotel/motel. The hotel, more like a motel or motor inn is so run down. The carpet was in bad shape. It's a flea bag motel disguising itself as upscale. When I stay in a hotel there are certain things I expect are a given...not here. I would never stgay here nor suggest it to my worst enemy...

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: motherthesequel
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Suites were very comfortable. We stayed there for Essence Fest 2008 and was amazed. When we booked our stay there, we were a little weary because of past reviews. I am here to say that all negative reviews must come from negative people. We stayed at the annex and it was very clean, service was excellent, staff was very friendly and we really enjoyed our stary. I would definetely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Shortie153
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a lovely long weekend in New Orleans and can't say enough about the French Quarter Suites Hotel. A group of seven of us went down to NOLA for a friend's 30th birthday and I was in charge of making the hotel arrangements. I looked at many hotels but had difficulty finding one that could acommodate our large group without splitting us up into several rooms. Many of us had not seen each other in years and wanted to spend as much time together as possible. I am so happy that I stumbled upon this hotel on Trip Advisor! The staff at the hotel was responsive, polite and downright generous. I had initally booked two, two-room suites but after talking to the management switched to the three bedroom executive suite in the annex. With five beds, a comfortable couch and a rollaway bed, we were able to comfortably fit our whole group in one suite. And what a suite it was! If you're looking for luxury acommodations this isn't it - but everything was clean, in working order, spacious and nice. We particularly enjoyed the balcony and courtyard which provided ample space to lounge and visit, in addition to the nicely appointed living room. I have absolutely no complaints about the room or the service. As others have pointed out in their reviews, the neighborhood around the hotel is not exactly posh, but was in easy walking distance to everything we wanted to see in New Orleans and allowed us to come and go throughout the day. The weather was hot and sticky, so coming back during the day to cool off before going out at night was essential. Most importantly though, as a woman, I never felt unsafe walking down North Rampart Street but taking normal precautions (ie: not walking alone at night) is still a good idea, as it would be in any city. Overall, I can't rave enough about my group's experience at the French Quarter Suites. We absolutely got a great value for our money and would certainly come back to the hotel again in the future (especially to visit the cutest dog who lives in the rental office and loves to greet guests). Thanks to the management for making my friend's birthday wonderful and this gathering of friends possible.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Jazzfest Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Rob_NJ
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and another couple had a great stay at the French Quarter Suites for this Jazzfest. After years of spending the week cramped in larger hotels with smaller rooms, it was a true pleasure to have such a spacious and comfortable living area in which to relax after the show. Our suite had two large beds, a living room area with chairs and a sofa, a kitchen, bathroom and porch -- and we enjoyed all of it. The staff and management were accommodating and extremely friendly. And the hotel even threw a Saturday-night crawfish boil for guests. Completely unexpected, and definitely appreciated. Honestly, this kind of friendly, personal service can't be beat. I'd stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Easter in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: nascarguy2
Reviews.Content: Easter in New Orleans was great. The French Quarter Suites Hotel was really a great discovery. Location is excellent, just 3 blocks from Bourbon St. The room was very spacious with everything you would need like a sitting area with sofabed, kitchen area with dining table, seperate sleeping room and bathroom. I had an accident the first night - I tripped and fell and cut up my face somewhat. They seemed very concerned and made sure I was ok. That is what hospitality is all about. Thanks and I will be back soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Not somewhere I would recommend”
Reviews.Author: DaveMon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a group of 6. The hotel is only a few blocks from the French Quarter...but the area is a place where you do not want to walk alone at night. We stayed in one of the "town homes" which was supposed to have 3 br + bath. The bedrooms were not "rooms"...there were no doors, nor any privacy from other roomates. Beds were laid out across open spaces that are connected with no dividers. You literally had to squeeze your way around other beds (if someone was sleeping you would definitely wake them). A majority of the staff was very unfriendly. Upon checkin, one male individual was extremely nice...the other was acting as if we were interupting something important that consumed him at his pc...he vaguely helped or answered our questions. Another time I went to use the wirless connection for my laptop (our room was not in range; you had to literally walk down 100ft to the main office)...I asked the female attendant (who was intentally reading a novel) if I could please get a couple more rolls of toilet paper. She stated that she didn't think she had any ...but would check or call the maintanence staff to get some. I said ok...I would be back after a few minutes working on my laptop. When I came back after 15 minutes she was still reading her novel. I asked her for the tp and she hadn't even looked...she then proceeded to go into a closet and said she didn't have any and she would call someone to get me some. An hour later someone arrived. Very, very lackadasical staff. The pictures online are very misleading. Plus, they do not detail information about the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay there again!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tink69
Reviews.Content: Accomodations were spacious and clean, if not a wee bit worn (but I prefer the term "comfortabe"). Staff was friendly and attentive. Small, tasty continental breakfast included, to get you started. On the very edge of the French Quarter, it's only a few blocks to Bourbon Street, past lots of gorgeous houses that you don't want to miss (click, click, click). Also only minutes away from Saint Louis Cemetary #1 (see mausoleum of Marie Laveau, practitioner of voodoo), or to catch the St. Charles streetcar to see the nearby Garden District. Great experience, would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: babylil
Reviews.Content: This place was great. We enjoyed our stay. It was close enough to the French Quarter to walk to everything. It had a quiet and relaxing atmosphere. The staff was super friendly and helpful. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: mrcoffee46200
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. It is an older place, but it is very well tended to. Out of the party zone of the quarter, but just a few blocks out when you want to get there. Very secure with onsite parking for a nominal fee. Perfect for the family! We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans B&B flavor”
Reviews.Author: dhodges103
Reviews.Content: We are frequent travelers to New Orleans, and needed to bring the dogs this time. Although we were concerned about the location of the hotel, as we don't usually stay on that side of the Quarter, we found our concerns to be unfounded. The residential areas on the Quarter side of the hotel were beautiful and quiet places to walk the dogs, and the three blocks off Bourbon were just a pleasant walk. We had some initial concerns about our room, and the manager Blake quickly acted to do everything possible to make us happy - and he did!! The room was beautiful and had all the flavor of New Orleans. Like most of the old B&B's in New Orleans, there are some things that aren't what we are used to in our own homes - but that is part of the charm of New Orleans' B&Bs, the combination of old and new. There was safe, covered parking at the main hotel, and a secured gated parking lot next to the annex. The prices were reasonable and they didn't gouge you with none refundable pet fees. We will definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Dustoid
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently for my job. I am used to four star service and a clean room. FQSH was fantastic.Me and three other OSU alums went down for the National Title game. From the moment we arrived we treated like old friends. We had the King High [-] house, that is to say that we had the best house, in one of the nicest cities I have ever been too. The property was majestic, something out of an old movie. The manager of the hotel was just one of the many people from NOLA that were happy just to have guests and he talked to us on a daily basis about the city. The overall experince of the hotel was fantastic, staff was great, the cleaning lady kept the place looking as clean as the first day. If you are going to NOLA, I highly suggest that you stay at FQSH and it's two blocks to Burbon St!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend this hotel to everyone!”
Reviews.Author: Christine75
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights and was extremely satisfied. It was right on the edge of the French Quarters. Our room had a nice size living room with a sofa bed, full kitchen, nice bathroom and seperate bedroom. The bedroom had a safe to keep your valuables. The breakfast wasn't the best, just the basics: doughnuts, juice, cereal, milk, coffee and cocoa. The price for the room was fairly cheap. We had to pay for the parking which was expected in the French Quarters. Which overall was around $110 per night. We must have went at the right time. When we stepped outside of our door, there was an awesome view of the courtyard. One night when we were there, we watched a movie being filmed right in front of the hotel. Which the 4 of us sat there and watched them filming. The main actress talked to my daughter and asked if she would hold her robe for her. My 12 year daughter was thrilled. Then the crew asked us if we wanted a soda or water, and of course the kids couldn't resist. Just becareful when walking the streets, there were alot of homeless people trying to bum money and cigerettes.

Reviews.Title: “Never going back”
Reviews.Author: AZFrequent_Traveler
Reviews.Content: We had been here in Oct 2006 and the only room we thought acceptable was the "servants" cottage at the end of the garage. We liked this place mainly because of the "secure" garage on the premises with a gate considering New Orleans very high crime rate, This year, we reserved the same room/cottage and called again in the afternoon to reconfirm our reservation as we would be arriving late. When we got there, the room was occupied and we were offered another room on the second floor with no apology. When we refused that room and started to make waves, they offered us the "executive" suite. As it was very late, we decided to spend the night. The suite is quite large but is dark and not attractive and looks run down. The door to the room would not stay shut unless bolted. When I sat on the couch, I thought I would hit the floor so soft it was. Two lightbulbs were burned in the bedroom ans the living area. Both TV remotes (room and L.R.) did not work. Internet did not reach the room and would only work in the office. We also heard stange noises during the night but I thought more about rodents than ghosts ! No offer was made to reduce the price despite our numerous complaints. The breakfast is not great for a city like New Orleans. Better head for World famous Cafe du Monde. Next time we'll definitely look to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Yucky and really not part of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: RosiePosie83
Reviews.Content: We 6 girls stayed here for a bachelorrette party and it is in a bad neighborhood that isn't really a part of the French Quarter but rather a few blocks down. The room itself was pretty disgusting, we had a two story town house with three bedrooms and the girls were scared to sit on the couch. They said the smell was horrible when they got there and there was a door that was locked and when you looked under it you could see another room where a skylight was apparently leaking and the room was now full of mold. So the whole weekend we all got sick and were congested when we got home. I really am not too picky and I am not exaggerating. The city is still recovering but I do think there must be better places than this. If it had just been me and my boyfriend, I would have left for sure! It is just not a nice place and it is out of the way. The Le Richelieu looked pretty nice when we walked by and it was near or was probably in the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Haunted”
Reviews.Author: antonnpost
Reviews.Content: Don't stay in room 213!!!!!! It was haunted, I couldn't even sleep. But we were staying one night so we didn't complain. There were noises everywhere in our room - sounds of dresser drawers being open and shut, scratching on the floor, sound of someone walking around, something that sounded like digging through something - i thought some big animal was going through my suitcase. Not to mention both my sister and I heard something fall off the end of our beds (I thought it was my notebook that was on my bed and I looked and it was still there), I felt something touching my foot while I was laying in bed, and we also heard someone walking around the room. SO - don't stay there in 213! I had to get drunk in order to sleep in that room (so I'd just pass out and not hear/ feel anything).

Reviews.Title: “A great place with a wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: putterb
Reviews.Content: A good friend of ours was on leave from Iraq and we all decided to go to New Orleans for Halloween. We booked two rooms for 3 couples at the French Quarter Suites Hotel. My girlfriend and I arrived several hours before everyone else and the gentleman working at the hotel offered to watch our luggage, for no additional fee so we could wander around the French Quarter. We had a good time but got tired quickly (late night before, early flight) and went back to the hotel. The person working the desk took our card to "hold" for our room till my buddy got in(he booked the rooms under his card and was paying for everyones rooms, early Christmas present I guess). After we checked in we walked into our room and our jaws dropped. We had a one bedroom suite, which has a full kitchen, a living room. It was awesome for what we wanted. The furnature was all very comfortable, and all the remotes worked (rare at hotels these days). The building felt VERY secure, and the pool was extremely clean, and you didn't get that "over chlorine smell" that you get from some hotel pools. The staff suggested many great places to eat, as well as fun things to check out. Also they arranged for three taxis to be out front to pick us up when we checked out (all our flights were at different times heading to different locations) with no hassles at all. We had a great trip down there. A few days later we checked our credit card balance and saw that we were charged for the rooms, in one quick phone call they took care of everything for us, as well as apologized several times for the mix up. We were so happy with this hotel and the service we got while we stayed there that we are booking another trip with them this April for Jazzfest, this time though were going to check out one of their townhouses.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value...Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: All-OverTraveler
Reviews.Content: Fellow travelers, I am a former native New Orleanian who tries to get back to New Orleans often. I am glad to have found French Quarter Suites Hotel. For me, it is like living in a French Quarter apartment combined with a hotel. I have stayed here several times, and have found all suites to be large, with living room, dining area, kitchen, large bedrooms and full bath. it feels a lot more homey. It is close to everything in the FrenchQuarter, on a main street easily accessed by car, unlike the traffic of the inner French Quarter. It has ample secured parking, which is unusual in this historic part of town. For a small hotel, the staff work exceedingly hard to meet all your needs just like their larger competitors. The pool area is lovely, and the on-site laundry is great if you are planning an extended stay. There is a breakfast room with free breakfast every morning with complimentary newspaper. During the day I can walk or take an inexpensive cab anywhere in the downtown N.O. area, as well as a short walk to French Quarter restaurants, coffee shops, entertainment, bars, stores and historical sites.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a rip off and the owner is nasty!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My experience is much like the one above. My sister had originally reserved a room for her, her boyfriend and his daughter for $79. Supposidly it was a coupon rate but it was posted that price on the web too b/c I looked. Anyhow, me and my daughter decided to go so my sister called back and they told her they could give her a 2 bedroom w/ 2 full size beds for $99. Great! We were excited. When we got there they told us that the people who were staying in our reserved room decided to stay over again and all they had was a 1 bedroom w/ 2 full size beds in the same room or a 2 bedroom with one full size bed and 1 king. Well, we had 3 adults and we didn't want to all sleep in the same room. Besides, we originally had a 2 bedroom reserved for $99. Well, when my sister went to pay the bill, they charged us $20 more a night. What! I was like, why did you pay that??? It was not our fault that they did not have the room available for what we reserved?!? I called back and asked for a manager. The man said he could help me. I told him our whole story and about how I did not agree that we had to pay more for an upgrad b/c they did not have our room available. He preceeded to tell me that we came in at a discount rate and that the room we stayed in was regular $250 (whatever, the website says $129) and all in all basically that he didn't care, he was the owner, we got a good rate, he didn't care what we thought and he would credit us back $40 and hung up on me. My sister was a repeat customer. Not anymore. Don't stay here. They are hateful, greedy, and liars!

Reviews.Title: “Who spends all their time in their room on vacation anyway?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay within walking distance of Bourbon Street, didn't want to rent a car, etc. We wanted to keep the trip reasonable but fun... didn't want any problems. After we booked I read some reviews on this site and I became weary (because of location, etc) I'm from Chicago so I figured things would be fine and they were. This place is within walking distance of the french quarter, a nice walk... wear good shoes if you don't plan on renting a car. We took the Airport Shuttle to and from the airport. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite and the price was great compared to the price to stay in the middle of the french quarter... not to mention all the noise at night around Bourbon Street. I felt safe walking back and forth (even at night) you just have to be careful and use common sense - don't carry a big purse, keep your money, etc. secure. You can always take a cab back to your hotel at night if you feel unsafe walking but I didn't see a problem walking day or night. The St. Louis cemetery and Armstrong Park are nearby (and free) My opinion is... your hotel is a place to sleep, the rooms were clean - we had no problem. I don't spend my vacations in my hotel room, the majority is spent outside the room so if your looking for something reasonable, this is the place. I rate this place average (compared to other places to stay in NO, it's not the Ritz Carlton so if your expectations are high... look to stay on Bourbon or right in the middle of the French Quarter just remember it's pretty loud at night)

Reviews.Title: “Get It In Writing”
Reviews.Author: jmoreno76
Reviews.Content: I was planning a trip to NOLA with some friends of mine, after hearing great reviews of this place I decided to give it a shot. I called the first time and spoke to the owner, when I asked what the hotel cost for the times I was going he had quoted me a rate much higher that what was advertised on the website. I played along with it and asked for several rates for different room categories and each one was significantly higher. Finally I mentioned it and asked why he was charging me more, it is low season because no conventions or events were happening and he said this is what was posted on the web too.
