When I pointed out that it wasnt he apologized and offered me what was on the rate. I made the reservation and asked for a fax. One week later looking around I noticed that on Fri and Sat the rates are higher than Sun, and it should drop. I called back and got someone who's name I forgot, he was very nasty pointing out that I called during check out time, and he couldnt talk to me. To call back on be put on hold. I told him I call back. When I did, I got the owner again. I told him that the rate for Sunday should have been lower than Fri and Sat and he agreed and cut off 50bucks. I was excited and asked for a fax, after days went by and no fax. I called again, the owner wasnt in but got someone else, who gave me a higher rate than what the owner gave me with no lower sunday rate. I was apalled and asked that the owner call me back. When he finally did, he said he never quoted me such rates. And it was back to square one. I was so upset that they never got the rates fixed and played around chargin what ever they pleased. I asked my reservation to be cancelled and they told me they had to charge me a processing fee. For what?? To rip up the index card my reservation was on. This place is such a joke, if it got to this point just being on the phone with them I didnt want to think what it would be once I checked in... I booked me and my guest at Faubourg Guest Suites much lower rate and the owner was so sweet. Ask for the rate in writing if you decide to stay at the French Quarter Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest Staff in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: MissBo99
Reviews.Content: My sister and I were in New Orleans for eight days in July and stayed at this hotel. While the hotel is not a 5-star in looks, the staff made us feel as if we were staying at one. The concierge, Velda, the best resource in the City of New Orleans, was very personable, outgoing and willing to assist with whatever we asked. We stayed in a one-bedroom double with a living room and kitchenette area. There was plenty of room for us to spread out and not get in each other's way, the beds were very comfortable and the room was clean when we arrived. We took advantage of the pool and the continental breakfast offered. We were in walking distance of the French Quarter and we also utilized the buses which stopped 1/2 a block from the hotel and ran frequently during the weekday. It was a wonderful experience and we are planning to return to New Orleans later this year would stay here again. The only thing that we would change would be to add Hi-speed Internet connections in the room. Great job Velda and Peter!!!

Reviews.Title: “Re: French Quarter Suites”
Reviews.Author: sterlingsilver
Reviews.Content: I agree with the previous post, this is by no means a 5 star hotel. We just got back from a 3 night stay. First the good. The staff here is extremely nice, and very helpful. They will go out of their way to make sure that you have a nice stay at their hotel. I give them an A+. Another feature that we enjoyed was the pool area, since we were there in the dead of summer it was nice to have a place to cool off. The building is also pretty secure. There are only two ways to enter, either through the lobby (that always has somebody in it) or through the gated parking area that you have to have a key to enter. If you plan on going out during the day to explore and coming back to the hotel before it gets late, then this is the place for you. It's a short walk to everything and the rates are very reasonable. We stayed in a 2 bedroom 1 bath unit w/ a living room and a small area w/ a mini-frig and microwave. There is also a balcony that runs all the way around both floors. The rooms were clean and spacious, but the furnishings were a bit outdated. Also, some of the lamps were not in working order. As other people have already mentioned. the hotel is located right on the outer fringe of the French Quarter in a high crime area. If you plan on going out at nights I strongly suggest that you either find someplace more towards the center of the FQ, travel in large groups, or that you take a taxi back to the hotel. On our last night there my husband and I were walking down Urseline only a block and a half from the hotel and we were assulted by two young men who robbed me of my purse. It was a frightening experience, but it could have been much worse! We plan on coming back to NO sometime in the future, but we definitely won't stay at this hotel again because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Just an average and OK hotel in a not to good of an area”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well, I have stayed at the French Quarter Suites Hotel when visiting New Orleans earlier this year. Checking out the reviews on this site I must admit that I am a little surprised about the hotels high 5-star rating. Having stayed at this and other hotels throughout the country, I like to state in my opiniated review, and in fair comparisons to any other hotels I have visited in the past, that this hotel does not meet any compatible 5-star hotel standards, and nor does it even come close to any fair other first-class hotel ratings. I do not like to be taken wrong, especially as this hotel is in overall review OK, and deserves a moderate average rating. However, it is fair to state that the hotel has some problems it has to deal with, and that the location, because of the nearby crime area, is being one of the biggest ones. There is no doubt that the hotel, being located on the far N.E. side of the French Quarter, is just a few blocks away from the dangerous, high crime rate bothered East New Orleans neighbourhood, and that especially tourists, as told by local police forces, are being warned of potential night street crimes nearby the hotel when walking home, running the potential risks of being mugged (police words, not mine!). As stated already, the hotel itself is OK, but it certainly does not offer any services and standards of hotels that justify a hotel rating within the 3*star to 5*star brackets. Again, the rooms are of average size and well furnished, but need a little renovation. The hotel services and the staff itself can be considered as average to good, but do not come close to any first-class hotel standards. In conclusion of this review, I honestly have to state that I will stay at another hotel during my next visit to New Orleans, especially as I expect to see a better value in return for my Dollars spend for hotel overnights in New Orleans. Knowing now, there are many nice hotels in the central New Orleans area that are located much better and offer many more services at a much better price per room night! I am sorry, but I can only rate this hotel as a 2-star in this review (i.e. Okay, but some problems - on this site)!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: helicopter
Reviews.Content: I can only echo what everyone else has said about the French Quarter Suites. We chose it because of the recommendations here. It is close enough to the action to walk to Bourbon St but far enough away to be quiet at night. Four of us from the UK shared a two bedroom suite for a week which was comfortable and a great rate. It was properly cleaned and fresh towels were provided every day. A complimentary breakfast was provided and although officially it ended at 10 am there were usually free pastries or muffins and strong coffee around much later for those who had been clubbing until the small hours. It has a nice suntrap swimming pool. We drove in from Memphis to be greeted by the lovely Velda who could not have been more helpful with recommendations for restaurants , clubs and tours. She provided mugs , tea bags and milk so we could have a cup of tea after our seven hours drive. We were also given help and advice by Blake , the owner , and being British, we just loved his two spaniels. This is a pet and people friendly hotel. The area was no more unsafe than any other part of New Orleans and we did notice regular police patrols along North Rampart . The hotel itself was very secure. We walked back a couple of times from Donnas ( a great Jazz Club) about three blocks down and never felt threatened, in fact I had more aggravation along the riverfront. We all loved the hotel and we look forward to returning to New Orleans soon

Reviews.Title: “A Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 nights at the FQS and can confirm any of the positive reviews listed here. The location is just far enough from the action in the Quarter that noise and traffic isn't an issue, but close enough that you can walk anywhere in a few minutes (restaurants and music clubs start just down the street). Our group never felt threatened or unsafe when walking in the area, even at night or alone (but did not dare a combination of the two, of course). The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, making great recommendations of places to go. We stayed in a 2-bedroom suite in the main building and the room was clean and nicely appointed and well-attended to by the housekeeping staff during our stay. The room faced North Rampart but we barely heard any street noise. If I've any complaints at all it would be about the half-broken showerhead, but a very minor incovenience that may not affect other rooms than ours. I plan to return and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: Garcias
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three day visit to New Orleans. It was purely by chance that we stayed at French Quarter Suites, and we were pleasantly surprised by what we found. The staff at the hotel was very nice and helpful, especially Scott White. His recommendations were excellent. We will definately stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Practically a steal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back from spending my spring break in New Orleans and stayed here at the french quarter suites. It was myself and 7 of my friends from school and we have nothing but praise for this place. The people at the front desk are some of the nicest people that are more than willing to do anything to help you w/ any of your needs. As far as the location, it is fine. I never once felt threatened or scared on my way into the french quarter. The rooms are very nice and i felt kept noice very well. W/ there being 8 guys Im sure we were loud a few times but never had any real complaints so that was nice. All of us loved the place and plan on staying there again next year. I am already in the plans for making arrangments for next year, great place and can not be beat for the price, practically a steal. Thanks again for everything

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, great price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for Jazz fest in 2003. The rrom we had booked was being repaired, so we were upgraded to the one room mini suite. Bedroom with a separate kitchen and living room. The staff was great, and the the place was kept clean. As this is a pet friendly hotel, you need to expect that there is some pet odor that will stay with the place no matter howm uch cleaning they do, so it has a bit of that pet smell to it, but nothing overwhelming. The pool is small, but a nice place to cool off if it is hot out. For Jazz fest, this place is great, as the bus to the festival runs right past the hotel. This is on the edge of the Quarter, and Rampart isn't the safest street in the world, but it is no worse than any other street in New Orleans. Just be careful and don't act like a rich drunken tourist wanting to get mugged and you should have no problems. The Annex next door is nice as well (same owners). There were a few parties thrown at the annex's pool, with Dj's and speaker sets, loud enough to hear in our room, but that didnt bother us since it was Jazz fest and we werent doing a whole lot of sleeping anyway. Several families were there with us. Everyone seemed pleased. Locked covered parking (free) is a huge plus as well.

Reviews.Title: “Safe and Super Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My mom, sisters and I had a lovely stay at the French Qyater Suites Hotel in April of 2004. We felt very safe...as far as that goes we felt safe everywhere we went. The rooms were very clean. One afternoon we just sat on the side of the pool and dipped our feet for a while. The office manager Velda is a jem!!!! She gave us directions and great eating advice. We are planning another trip in the fall and plan on staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Suites!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My familyand I stayed at this hotel in December, 2004. We loved the place! The location is convenient and the rooms are clean and well-appointed. I can't say enough about the staff, they are extremely welcoming and helpful. We can't wait to stay there again!

HotelInfo.Name: French Quarter Suites Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 1119 North Rampart Street, New Orleans, LA 70116
